title: Landslide in Sudan's Darfur Kills 1,000; Sole Survivor Found
snippets: The landslide on Sunday happened after heavy rain and "levelled" a remote mountainous village, the group says.
A landslide triggered by heavy rain destroyed an entire village in Sudan’s Darfur, killing more than 1,000 people.
Sudan Liberation Movement/Army appeals for UN help to recover bodies from village buried by landslide after heavy rain.
The landslide wiped out an entire village in the Marra Mountains, according to the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army. Only one person is said to have survived.

Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor

More than 1,000 people were killed in a landslide in western Sudan on Sunday, according to a rebel group that controls the area.

The landslide, which followed heavy rain, destroyed a
The landslide leveled a village in the remote Marra mountains, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army said. It asked international aid organizations for help in recovering bodies.
titles: At least 1,000 killed in Sudan landslide, armed group says
Sudan landslide ‘kills more than 1,000’
Landslide kills more than 1,000 in Sudan’s Darfur region, armed group says
Sudan landslide kills over 1,000 people, says rebel group
Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
Landslide Kills More Than 1,000 People in Sudan, Rebel Group Says
summary: A landslide in Sudan's Darfur region, caused by heavy rain, destroyed a village in the Marra Mountains, leaving over 1,000 people dead with only one survivor. The Sudan Liberation Movement/Army, which controls the area, has called for international assistance to recover bodies.

title: Osaka Defeats Gauff to Reach First Grand Slam Quarterfinal Since 2021
snippets: Two-time US Open champion Naomi Osaka earns her most impressive win since returning to the tour by knocking out third seed Coco Gauff.
Two-time US Open tennis champion Osaka upset Gauff in straight sets, while Iga Swiatek beat Ekaterina Alexandrova.
Osaka jumped on Gauff early and held strong from there on out

• Four-times grand-slam champion wins 6-3, 6-2

  • Osaka has always won title after reaching last eight

Naomi Osaka turned back the clock on Monday in New York, producing the cleanest big‑stage performance of her comeback from maternity leave to overwhelm Coco Gau
In a battle of former U.S. Open champions, Naomi Osaka knocked out Coco Gauff 6-3, 6-2 on Monday to reach her first Grand Slam quarterfinal in four years.

title: Nestlé Fires CEO Freixe Over Conduct, Names Navratil New Chief
snippets: The food giant says Laurent Freixe had an "undisclosed" relationship with "a direct subordinate".

Nestlé has dismissed its chief executive, Laurent Freixe, after an investigation into an “undisclosed romantic relationship” with a subordinate that was found to have breached i
The Swiss food giant said Laurent Freixe’s dismissal was effective immediately and named longtime executive Philipp Navratil as its new CEO.
Philipp Navratil, chief executive of Nestlé Nespresso, was named Freixe’s successor, effective immediately.
Nestlé says it has dismissed its CEO Laurent Freixe after he failed to disclose a romantic relationship with a direct subordinate.

Philipp Navratil, previously of Nestlé Nespresso, was appointed as the new CEO, marking the company's third chief executive change in just over a year.

title: Oscar-Nominee Graham Greene Passes Away at 73
snippets: The legendary Canadian actor was also known for his roles in The Green Mile and Maverick.

The trailblazing Canadian First Nations actor, who was nominated for an Academy Award, died in Toronto after a long illness

Graham Greene, the prolific Oscar-nominated Canadian First Nations actor and Hollywood trailblazer, has died aged 73 in a Toronto hospital after a long illness.
Graham Greene, best known for his role as Kicking Bird in Kevin Costner’s 1990 film "Dances with Wolves," died September 1. He was 73.

TORONTO — Oscar-nominated Canadian actor Graham Greene, who broke through with memorable roles across several genres at a time when the entertainment industry shunned Indigenous talent, has died at age 73. Greene’s management team said he died on Monday in Stratford, Ont., after a long illness. The
titles: Dances With Wolves star Graham Greene dies aged 73
Graham Greene, Dances with Wolves actor, dies aged 73
Graham Greene, Oscar Nominated Actor ‘In Dances With Wolves,’ Dies At 73
Canadian actor Graham Greene, known for role in “Dances With Wolves,’ dies at 73
summary: Graham Greene, the Oscar-nominated Canadian First Nations actor known for his roles in "Dances with Wolves," "The Green Mile," and "Maverick," has died at age 73 in Toronto after a long illness. Greene, celebrated for breaking barriers for Indigenous actors in Hollywood, passed away on September 1.

title: China Pledges $280M in Aid to SCO Members at Tianjin Summit
snippets: Chinese President Xi Jinping is hosting a high-profile summit with leaders from Russia, North Korea and India gathering among others in a challenge to U.S. influence.
Chinese President Xi Jinping outlines plans for new development bank and financing options for SCO members.
A viral photo of Modi, Xi and Putin at the SCO summit highlights shifting power, unresolved tensions and the limits of global alliances.
Their display of friendship in China was aimed at projecting an alternative to U.S. global leadership, even as serious differences among them remain.
It is unclear if the SCO summit will pave the way for any breakthroughs in easing tensions, though Beijing has sought to cast itself as a global peacemaker.
titles: China's Xi hosts Putin and Modi at Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit
China, Russia pledge new global order at Shanghai Cooperation summit
Behind the smiles with Putin, Modi and Xi at China summit
Xi, Putin and Modi Try to Signal Unity at China Summit
China's Xi urges AI cooperation, rejects ‘Cold War mentality’ at SCO summit
summary: At a summit in Tianjin, the Chinese leader pledged $280 million in aid to members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO). The contribution aims to support the SCO, but it remains uncertain if this will lead to significant breakthroughs in reducing tensions among member states. Beijing is positioning itself as a global peacemaker through this gesture.

Manchester City's James Trafford encountered significant challenges, and Erik ten Hag was notably dismissed, adding drama to the proceedings. title: Afghanistan Earthquake Kills 900, Injures 2,500; Aid Sought
snippets: Rescuers try to reach isolated villages in eastern Kunar province after a 6.0 quake kills 800 people and wounds 2,800.

Rescuers search into the night for people trapped under debris of mud and stone homes in steep valleys

The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 900 people and left thousands injured.

Rescuers searched into the night on
The quake, near the border with Pakistan, injured more than 2,500 people in mountainous areas that rescue workers took hours to reach.
Hundreds of people were killed and more than 2,500 were injured, according to the Taliban government, and the death toll was expected to rise.
Rescue workers struggled to reach isolated areas in eastern Afghanistan after a magnitude 6.0 quake.
titles: Afghanistan earthquake live: Search for survivors on after 900 killed
Afghanistan earthquake: Taliban appeal for aid as death toll rises to 900
Afghanistan Earthquake Leaves More Than 800 Dead
What to Know About the Earthquake in Afghanistan
An Earthquake Killed Hundreds in Afghanistan
summary: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck eastern Kunar province, Afghanistan, killing over 900 people and injuring more than 2,500. Rescue efforts continue in isolated, mountainous areas, with rescuers working through the night. The Taliban government has requested international aid to cope with the disaster's aftermath.

title: Belgium to Recognize Palestine, Impose Sanctions on Israel Amid Gaza Airstrikes
snippets: FM Maxime Prevot says his country will recognise Palestine this month and impose 12 'firm sanctions' on Israel.

Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot​​ said the move is to pressure the Israeli government to respect international law. This comes as new Israeli airstrikes were reported in Gaza. DW has the latest.

Foreign minister says move is not aimed at Israeli people but ‘ensuring their government respects international and humanitarian law’

The Palestinian foreign ministry has said it
titles: Belgium to recognise Palestinian statehood, impose sanctions on Israel

summary: Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot announced Belgium will recognize Palestine and impose 12 sanctions on Israel to pressure its government to respect international law. This decision follows recent Israeli airstrikes in Gaza. The move is targeted not at the Israeli people but at ensuring their government adheres to international and humanitarian law.

title: Judge Halts Deportation of Guatemalan Children by U.S. Government
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxQTjhWc3lTc0cwU09qZDl0WWxENWFtbXlwdUwxVEZWeWk3dW5CemVJTjhfQXRjNllNeFBGb1lrTlhIM3VCbU9rbkNaNXVTeEZwYXlyTTJYWFlESUY2WVE1SndXVGpiZTdQeEpHVldKdHQyLVBmUGFhVGs5cTkybkh2Wjd6czdBYlBSZHc0RjUtbkk?oc=5" target="_blank">Judge halts deportation of hundr
A federal judge rushed an emergency hearing after learning that the Trump administration was moving to deport children to Guatemala despite an order she had issued earlier Sunday.
The temporary block ended another last-minute flurry of legal action over the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.
titles: Judge halts deportation of hundreds of Guatemalan children - Axios
Judge orders administration to halt deportation of hundreds of Guatemalan children
Judge Halts U.S. Effort to Deport Guatemalan Children as Planes Sit on Tarmac
summary: A federal judge issued a temporary restraining order, halting the U.S. government's attempt to deport hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children without proper immigration proceedings. This decision, made by District Judge Sparkle Sooknanan, comes after a legal complaint on behalf of 10 children, temporarily preventing these deportations for at least 14 days as the legal process continues. This move interrupts the Trump administration's broader immigration crackdown efforts.

title: EU Commission Plane Lands with Maps Amid Suspected Russian GPS Jamming
snippets: The Bulgarian authorities believe that Russia disrupted navigation signals that would have been used by a plane carrying Ursula von der Leyen, European officials said.
The plane landed safely and Ursula von der Leyen will continue her planned tour of the European Union’s nations bordering Russia and Belarus, a spokesperson said.
titles: Russia Suspected of Jamming GPS for E.U. Leader’s Plane, Officials Say
Russia suspected of jamming navigation on European Commission president’s plane, official says
summary: The European Commission reported that a plane carrying President Ursula von der Leyen to Bulgaria experienced navigation disruption due to suspected GPS jamming on Sunday. The EU and Bulgarian authorities suspect Russia was behind the interference, which forced the aircraft to land using paper maps. The situation is under investigation.
